Explorer

**Stat Explorer Module:** Visualizing how Pok√©mon stats relate to each other.

### <span class="dex-title">Module 01 ‚Äî Trainer Controls</span> {data-width=30}

<div class="trainer-panel">

<span class="caption-warm">Use these settings to customize your stat exploration as a trainer.</span>

```{r}
# Controls for map page ‚Äî real data will be linked later

tagList(
  div(class = "control-label", "Primary Type Filter"),
  selectInput(
    "filter_type",
    NULL,
    choices = c("All"),
    selected = "All"
  ),
  div(class = "control-label", "Generation Filter"),
  selectInput(
    "filter_gen",
    NULL,
    choices = c("All"),
    selected = "All"
  ),
  div(class = "control-label", "X-Axis Stat"),
  selectInput(
    "x_stat",
    NULL,
    choices = c(
      "HP" = "hp",
      "Attack" = "attack",
      "Defense" = "defense",
      "Special Attack" = "special_attack",
      "Special Defense" = "special_defense",
      "Speed" = "speed"
    ),
    selected = "attack"
  ),
  div(class = "control-label", "Y-Axis Stat"),
  selectInput(
    "y_stat",
    NULL,
    choices = c(
      "HP" = "hp",
      "Attack" = "attack",
      "Defense" = "defense",
      "Special Attack" = "special_attack",
      "Special Defense" = "special_defense",
      "Speed" = "speed"
    ),
    selected = "defense"
  )
)
```


</div>

### <span class="dex-title">Module 02 ‚Äî Stat Mapping Interface</span> {data-width=70}

<div class="map-panel">

<span class="caption-warm">Adjust filters and stat axes to visualize how different Pok√©mon are positioned in stat space.</span>

```{r}
# Placeholder plot ‚Äî safe and error-free
renderPlot({
  ggplot2::ggplot(data.frame(x = 0, y = 0), ggplot2::aes(x, y)) +
    ggplot2::geom_point(alpha = 0) +
    ggplot2::labs(title = "Pok√©mon Stat Map") +
    ggplot2::theme_void()
})
```

### <span class="dex-title">Pok√©dex Field Notes</span> üåø

<div class="notes-card">

**Design Notes (Melanie):**

- This is the layout for the Stat Map page of our Pok√©dex dashboard.  
- ‚ÄúTrainer Controls‚Äù and ‚ÄúStat Mapping Interface‚Äù use Pok√©dex-style wording to match the theme.  
- The trainer panel groups all interactive controls in one place for a clean, guided experience.  
- The stat map panel uses a faint Pok√©ball ring effect and warm tones to keep the aesthetic subtle but thematic.  
- When the user changes the selected stats or filters, the coded version of this page will update the visualization in the map panel.  
- Kyle and Tayin will replace the placeholder plot with the real stat visualizations.  
- The `journal` theme plus custom styling blend a naturalist field-guide feel with a modern Pok√©dex interface.

</div>
